summary: Bran: I’m paralyzed from the waist down and am psychic. Arya: I was in hiding for years and forced to serve my sworn enemy. Jon:...
body:
Bran: I’m paralyzed from the waist down and am psychic.

Arya: I was in hiding for years and forced to serve my sworn enemy.

Jon: But did you die?

tags: i've fallen down this rabbit hole
summary: Arya: I made you a nice hot cup of coffee. Ned: It’s cold. Arya: Nice cup of coffee. Ned: It’s horrible. Arya: Cup of coffee....
body:
Arya: I made you a nice hot cup of coffee.

Ned: It’s cold.

Arya: Nice cup of coffee.

Ned: It’s horrible.

Arya: Cup of coffee.

Ned: I’m not even sure this is coffee.

Arya: Cup.

blog.description:
Welcome to my ramblings! She, older than you, Down Under, blogging about all the things I like.  If you want to know more, go to links...
_______________________________

title: Sunday Six
body:
She opened her mouth and bit him.

Not harshly, just a nibble – enough to taste the salt on his skin. Her hand felt the warmth of his flesh and the steady thumping of his heart under her fingers, and the scent of him lingered still in her nose. Gendry gasped, but didn’t move.

Arya released her hold and raised her head.

reblog.comment:

Arya released her hold and raised her head.

Arya released her hold and raised her head.

Arya released her hold and raised her head.

blog.name: aqueenofmarble
blog.title: Do I Dare Disturb the Universe?

summary: People nowadays love to throw around words they don‘t even know the meaning of. I‘ve seen people calling Arya...
body:
People nowadays love to throw around words they don‘t even know the meaning of. I‘ve seen people calling Arya psychopathic/sociopathic and what not. These are mental illnesses that make themselves noticeable early on in the childhood already.

Arya never showed any signs of psychopathy/sociopathy in her childhood. She was only tomboyish and preferred traditionally masculine activities over feminine ones. She didn‘t lack empathy, compassion or social skills. Her traumatic experiences turned her into a more ruthless person and made her less sensitive to violence.

The definition of a psychopath is a “person suffering from chronic mental disorder with abnormal or violent social behaviour“. I think everyone with some common sense can agree on the fact that Arya cannot be a psychopath because a) it is a chronic mental disorder!!! and b) she only kills those that have wronged her or her loved ones. She doesn‘t go around killing people that slightly harm her. If you think that then…I‘m afraid we‘re not watching the same show (or read the same books).

She had a normal human conversation with the Lannister soldiers who btw were people that worked for the ones responsible for her family‘s death. She gave hot pie a warm goodbye. She didn’t kill the guards that wouldn’t let her in. She took her time to negotiate with them and tried to convince them to let her through the gates. And even though she knew about LF‘s schemes she didn’t simply kill him. Instead she spied on him to gain a perspective and information. Anyone thinking she‘s a psychopath or sociopath is ignorant of the canon material and struggles with understanding complex flawed characters.

Arya Stark is a complex, multilayered, strong, sensitive, loving, brave, resilient, intelligent, emotional and resourceful young woman who has witnessed horrible things as a child and went through extremely traumatic experiences which have shaped her view on the world and her philosophy. For Arya it has always been kill or be killed. She was on the road alone and without protection as an 11yo girl and was a slave in Harrenhal and was abused in the HoBaW. She had to learn how to defend herself early on but that didn’t make her heartless or murderous.

The moment she heard about Jon being in Winterfell she was the old Arya again. The one who always put her family first. Without even thinking twice she abandoned her list and her plan to kill Cersei - who was may I add one of the people she wanted to kill the most, she was one of the first people on her list and a reason for her father‘s death - and went straight to Winterfell. She chose her family over the list that was a huge part of her arc (in the show at least). So her going to Winterfell is her starting to embrace her identity again - She is Arya Stark of Winterfell. She is not a psychopath. She is not a sociopath. She is not no one. She is not just an executioner (seriously fuck you D&D). She is a Stark, a she-wolf, a friend, a sister, a daughter, a survivor, a lover and a fighter. Emotion is what drives her. Emotion in all kinds of forms. Anger or sadness or love. Anything. Those are all emotions. And it is time to understand and appreciate the complexities of Arya and all characters tbh esp female characters that get hate for no reason and are always put into boxes. I‘m sick of all the ignorance and gratuitous hate. Grow a brain, think for yourself and make up your own opinion. Stop thinking in boxes.

And finally to come back to my first point: Inform yourself about a topic a/o look up the definition of a term before casually using it when you feel like it. Esp when it‘s a sensitive and serious issue that is the case.

summary: D&D‘s notes on Arya‘s first chapter must look like this: sucks at sewing —> kinda tomboy —> serves as foil to feminine sister —>...
body:
D&D‘s notes on Arya‘s first chapter must look like this: sucks at sewing —> kinda tomboy —> serves as foil to feminine sister —> likely hates women and femininity —> not interested in romance —> not capable to give/receive love —> only interests/skills are swords —> just wants to fight ofc —> hates people —> def a loner then —> sociopath

Conclusion: sucks at sewing —> sociopath

Conclusion: sucks at sewing —> sociopath

tags: a song of ice and fire
caption: that’s not me.

summary: Every time I see the scene at the end of episode two where Joffery lies about what happened with Arya and the butchers boy I...
body:
Every time I see the scene at the end of episode two where Joffery lies about what happened with Arya and the butchers boy I silently will Sansa to tell the truth, even though I know she won’t.

And then I get even more upset because despite what happened Arya still begs them not to kill Lady, and I don’t think it’s completely because Lady is innocent, I think part of it has to be because she just lost her wolf, she knows how badly it will hurt Sansa.

blog.name: hufflepuffdisaster
blog.title: thank carol danvers for brie larson
blog.description: hi, I’m ben and welcome to my dumpster fire

summary: arya about jon: jon grinned, reached over, and messed up her hair. arya flushed. they had always been close. jon had their...
body:
arya about jon: jon grinned, reached over, and messed up her hair. arya flushed. they had always been close. jon had their father’s face, as she did. they were the only ones.

arya about jon: she could find nymeria in the wild woods below the trident, and together they’d return to winterfell, or run to jon on the wall. she found herself wishing that jon was here with her now. then maybe she wouldn’t feel so alone.

arya about jon: but it was jon snow she thought of most. she wished somehow they could come to the wall before winterfell, so jon might muss up her hair and call her “little sister.” she’d tell him, “I missed you,” and he’d say it too at the very same moment, the way they always used to say things together. she would have liked that. she would have liked that better than anything.

arya about jon: “he’s with the night’s watch on the wall.” maybe I should go to the wall instead of riverrun. jon wouldn’t care who I killed or whether I brushed my hair… “jon looks like me, even though he’s bastard-born. he used to muss my hair and call me ‘little sister.’” arya missed jon most of all. just saying his name made her sad.

arya about jon: she still had one brother left. jon will want me, even if no one else does. he’ll call me “little sister” and muss my hair.

arya about jon: needle was jon snow’s smile. he used to mess my hair and call me “little sister,” she remembered, and suddenly there were tears in her eyes.

sandra stans: “i’m pretty sure jon and arya’s reunion won’t be so emotional, i bet it won’t be as tear jerking as sansa’s and jon’s, arya is too lost now”

arya about jon: she could find nymeria in the wild woods below the trident, and together they’d return to winterfell, or run to jon on the wall. she found herself wishing that jon was here with her now. then maybe she wouldn’t feel so alone.

arya about jon: but it was jon snow she thought of most. she wished somehow they could come to the wall before winterfell, so jon might muss up her hair and call her “little sister.” she’d tell him, “I missed you,” and he’d say it too at the very same moment, the way they always used to say things together. she would have liked that. she would have liked that better than anything.

arya about jon: “he’s with the night’s watch on the wall.” maybe I should go to the wall instead of riverrun. jon wouldn’t care who I killed or whether I brushed my hair… “jon looks like me, even though he’s bastard-born. he used to muss my hair and call me ‘little sister.’” arya missed jon most of all. just saying his name made her sad.

arya about jon: she still had one brother left. jon will want me, even if no one else does. he’ll call me “little sister” and muss my hair.

arya about jon: needle was jon snow’s smile. he used to mess my hair and call me “little sister,” she remembered, and suddenly there were tears in her eyes.

sandra stans: “i’m pretty sure jon and arya’s reunion won’t be so emotional, i bet it won’t be as tear jerking as sansa’s and jon’s, arya is too lost now”
trail.content:
arya about jon: jon grinned, reached over, and messed up her hair. arya flushed. they had always been close. jon had their father’s face, as she did. they were the only ones.

arya about jon: she could find nymeria in the wild woods below the trident, and together they’d return to winterfell, or run to jon on the wall. she found herself wishing that jon was here with her now. then maybe she wouldn’t feel so alone.

arya about jon: but it was jon snow she thought of most. she wished somehow they could come to the wall before winterfell, so jon might muss up her hair and call her “little sister.” she’d tell him, “I missed you,” and he’d say it too at the very same moment, the way they always used to say things together. she would have liked that. she would have liked that better than anything.

arya about jon: “he’s with the night’s watch on the wall.” maybe I should go to the wall instead of riverrun. jon wouldn’t care who I killed or whether I brushed my hair… “jon looks like me, even though he’s bastard-born. he used to muss my hair and call me ‘little sister.’” arya missed jon most of all. just saying his name made her sad.

arya about jon: she still had one brother left. jon will want me, even if no one else does. he’ll call me “little sister” and muss my hair.

arya about jon: needle was jon snow’s smile. he used to mess my hair and call me “little sister,” she remembered, and suddenly there were tears in her eyes.

sandra stans: “i’m pretty sure jon and arya’s reunion won’t be so emotional, i bet it won’t be as tear jerking as sansa’s and jon’s, arya is too lost now”

body:
Dear Game Of Thrones fans

Pls help me. Me and my mum are arguing over this.

(Now quick disclaimer I haven’t watched it yet - waiting to binge because cliffhangers are a bitch)

So there are an army of guys without their dicks and I was like

  • “So how do they pee?”
  • Well, there’d be a hole Maya
  • “Oh okay….. do they squat then?”
  • No they’d still aim.
  • “But how ma? There’s nothing to do any aiming with?”
  • Well they’re badass soldiers, they can do it.
  • “Okay? Seriously wouldn’t they squat?”
  • No because they wouldn’t want to be known for not having a Willy
  • “But there’s a w(hole) army! It’s not one guy. Forget social norms, they won’t care.”
  • Maya, come on. They’re strong masculine men, they’re not not caring.
  • “Didn’t understand that bit but I guess?”
  • ~ Five minutes later ~
  • “Itd run down their leg.”

And that was the argument -my mum thinks that they’d want to look tough and normal so they’d aim ‘there’s not plumbing back then’. But they’d be squatting to poo so I say they’d just kinda do that???

I don’t know. Please someone, ANYONE, add to this

(p.s. my step dad was no help - he didn’t like the question)

summary: ☝️Truly, one of the best Game of Thrones Sansa I book analysis to date. These guys know how to avoid POV traps that even...
body: ☝️Truly, one of the best Game of Thrones Sansa I book analysis to date. These guys know how to avoid POV traps that even seasoned readers often miss. The video is also a continuation although “stark contrast” companion piece from her sister Aryas POV. I can’t wait for more. ❤️

summary: braynsbronnson  This is maybe a dumb question, but do we know for a fact that Edric inherited Starfall through his father?  Is...
body:
braynsbronnson

This is maybe a dumb question, but do we know for a fact that Edric inherited Starfall through his father?  Is it possible that his mom was the Eldest and Lady Dayne?  If it is, does it matter?

Maybe once she got to Riverrun she could write Jon a letter and tell him what Ned Dayne had said. “There was an Arthur Dayne,” she remembered. “The one they called the Sword of the Morning.”

“My father was Ser Arthur’s elder brother. Lady Ashara was my aunt. I never knew her, though. She threw herself into the sea from atop the Palestone Swordbefore I was born." 

ARYA VIII, ASOS
